japanese: 明日の授業の準備をした方がいいよ。
english: You should prepare for tomorrow's lessons.

japanese: 明日の朝、忘れずにこの手紙を出すんだよ。
english: Remember to mail this letter tomorrow morning.

japanese: 午前中に電話しますね。
english: I'll give you a call in the morning.

japanese: 朝のうちに電話するよ。
english: I'll give you a call in the morning.

japanese: 明日の朝は、７時には起きてよ。
english: Get up at seven tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日の朝まで待って。
english: Wait until tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日、朝一で彼に電話かけよっと。
english: I'll call him first thing in the morning.

japanese: 明日の朝、忘れずに車で迎えに来てよ。
english: Don't forget to pick me up tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日の朝に来て。
english: Come tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日の朝そっちに寄って、車に乗せていってあげるよ。
english: I'll come by and pick you up tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日の朝6時にモーニングコールをお願いします。
english: I'd like a wake-up call at six tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日の天気予報ってどうなってる？
english: What's the weather forecast for tomorrow?

japanese: 明日の夜、また集まりましょうか。
english: Let's get together again tomorrow evening.

japanese: 明日の夜、また集まろっか。
english: Let's get together again tomorrow evening.

japanese: 明日のディナーを予約したいのですが。
english: I'd like to make reservations for dinner tomorrow.

japanese: 明日の夜とかどう？
english: How about tomorrow night?

japanese: 明日の晩は、ひま？
english: Are you free tomorrow evening?

japanese: 明日は、お寺さん巡りをしよう。
english: Let's visit some temples tomorrow.

japanese: 明日の朝は六時に起きます。
english: I'm getting up at six o'clock tomorrow morning.

japanese: 明日は休日です。
english: It is a holiday tomorrow.

japanese: 明日は激しい雨が予測されます。
english: We anticipate a heavy rainfall tomorrow.

japanese: 明日の予定は？
english: What's your schedule for tomorrow?

japanese: 明日もまた暑くなるかな？
english: Will it be hot again tomorrow?

japanese: 明日も暑くなるのかな？
english: Will it be hot again tomorrow?

japanese: 明日は一日がかりでレポートの作成だよ。
english: I will be working on my report all day tomorrow.

japanese: 明日はほぼ確実に晴れだよ。
english: It ought to be fine tomorrow.

japanese: 明日は雪になるだろう。
english: It'll snow tomorrow.

japanese: 明日は別に何もすることはないよ。
english: I have nothing in particular to do tomorrow.

japanese: 明日って、予定が入ってる？
english: Are you booked for tomorrow?

japanese: 明日来てください。
english: You'll have to come tomorrow.

japanese: 明日また話そうよ。
english: Maybe we should talk again tomorrow.

japanese: 明日まで犬の面倒を見てあげるよ。
english: I'll take care of the dog till tomorrow.

japanese: 明日までには知っておかないといけない。
english: I need to know by tomorrow.

japanese: 明日までに知っておく必要がある。
english: I need to know by tomorrow.

japanese: 明日までに論文をいくつか書かなければいけない。
english: I have a few essays to write by tomorrow.

japanese: 明日までに履修登録をしなきゃいけないんだ。
english: We must register for the courses that we're going to take by tomorrow.

japanese: 明日またここに来るね。
english: I'll come here again tomorrow.

japanese: 明日、レントゲンを撮りに行かなきゃいけないんだ。
english: I have to go and have an X-ray tomorrow.

japanese: 明日、先生に診てもらわなきゃ。
english: I must pay a visit to the doctor tomorrow.

japanese: 明日雨にならないといいな。
english: I hope it does not rain tomorrow.

japanese: 明日雨降らないといいな。
english: I hope it does not rain tomorrow.

japanese: 明日雨だったら行かないよ。
english: If it rains tomorrow, I won't go.

japanese: 明日何が起こるかなんて、誰にも分からないだろ。
english: Who knows what will happen tomorrow?

japanese: また明日学校でね。
english: See you tomorrow at school.

japanese: 明日さ、お前の車貸してくれよ。
english: Lend me your car tomorrow.

japanese: 明日の朝、事務所にお伺いしてもよろしいでしょうか。
english: May I come to see you at your office tomorrow morning?

japanese: 明日、図書館でまたね。
english: See you tomorrow at the library.

japanese: また明日、図書館でね。
english: See you tomorrow at the library.

japanese: 明日の天気はなんだろう。
english: I wonder what the weather will be like tomorrow.

japanese: 明日７時に起こすのを忘れないでくださいね。
english: Please remember to wake me up at seven tomorrow.

japanese: 明日って、遊びに来てくれるんだよね？
english: Come and see me tomorrow, won't you?

japanese: 明日来れる？
english: Will you be able to come tomorrow?

japanese: 迷子になっちゃうぞ。
english: You'll get lost.

japanese: その迷子の女の子は泣きじゃくりながら名前を言った。
english: The stray girl sobbed her name.

japanese: 免税店では何も買わなかったよ。
english: I didn't buy anything at the duty-free shops.

japanese: 向かい合って、立って。
english: Stand face to face.

japanese: 困ったことになるのではないかと心配だ。
english: I am afraid there will be trouble.

japanese: すごく面白そうですね。
english: It seems very interesting.

japanese: とても面白そうですね。
english: It seems very interesting.

japanese: 毛布はありますか。
english: Do you have blankets?

japanese: 毛布を持ってきていただけますか？
english: Could you bring me a blanket?

japanese: 木は燃えます。
english: Wood burns.

japanese: 私は木の下に避難しなければならなかった。
english: I had to take shelter under a tree.

japanese: 木立の合間から家が見えます。
english: I see a house among the trees.

japanese: 紅葉が始まった。
english: The leaves began to turn red and yellow.

japanese: 木々の葉は秋には黄色く色づく。
english: The leaves of the trees turn yellow in fall.

japanese: 灯台下暗し。
english: You can't see the forest for the trees.

japanese: この木のせいで森を見ることができません。
english: You can't see the forest for the trees.

japanese: 木々がわたしを慰めてくれた。
english: The trees comforted me.

japanese: 私たちは木の下に避難した。
english: We took shelter under a tree.

japanese: 木曜日より金曜日に来ていただきたいのですが。
english: I would rather you came on Friday than on Thursday.

japanese: 黙って聞け！
english: Shut up and listen!

japanese: 黙ってろ。
english: Shut your big mouth.

japanese: 黙っててよ。
english: Shut your big mouth.

japanese: 見渡す限り、そこには砂しかなかった。
english: As far as the eye could see, there was nothing but sand.

japanese: 私は光が見える。
english: I can see the light.

japanese: 目が覚めると、私たちは沖を漂流していた。
english: When we awoke, we were adrift on the open sea.

japanese: 去る者は日々に疎し。
english: Out of sight, out of mind.

japanese: 目に砂が入った。
english: I got some sand in my eye.

japanese: 起きてるよ。
english: I'm awake.

japanese: 目を開けて。
english: Open your eyes.

japanese: 目を開けてみな。
english: Open your eyes.

japanese: 起きて！
english: Wake up!

japanese: 起きろ！
english: Wake up!

japanese: 彼は目を閉じたままベンチに座っていた。
english: He was sitting on a bench with his eyes closed.

japanese: 彼は目を閉じてベンチに座っていた。
english: He was sitting on a bench with his eyes closed.

japanese: 彼は目をつむったままベンチに座っていた。
english: He was sitting on a bench with his eyes closed.

japanese: 目を閉じないで。
english: Don't shut your eyes.

japanese: 私は目覚ましを7時にセットします。
english: I'll set the alarm for seven o'clock.

japanese: 目的は必ずしも手段を正当化するものではない。
english: The end does not always justify the means.

japanese: 問題はどっちにするかだよな。
english: The question is which to choose.

japanese: 脱線しないようにしなきゃな。
english: We've got to stick to the point.

japanese: ゲートは６時に閉まります。
english: The gate is closed at six.

japanese: 門はすごく狭いので、その車が通り抜けるのは無理ですよ。
english: The gate is so narrow that the car can't pass through it.

japanese: 門ならもう開いてるよ。
english: The gate is open now.

japanese: 私は門をくぐって通りへと出た。
english: I went through the gate out onto the street.

japanese: 夜はスタジオの電気をつけないんだ。
english: I don't switch on the light in my studio at night.

japanese: 午後八時です。
english: It's eight o'clock at night.

japanese: 夜更かしは駄目だからね。
english: You must not stay up late.

japanese: 夜になると熱が出るんです。
english: I have fever at night.

japanese: 午前０時過ぎに目が覚めた。
english: We woke up after midnight.

japanese: 僕らは真夜中を過ぎて目を覚ました。
english: We woke up after midnight.

japanese: 野球が好きな人もいれば、サッカーが好きな人もいる。
english: Some people like baseball, others like soccer.

japanese: 大雨のため、野球の試合は中止になった。
english: The baseball game was canceled because of the heavy rain.

japanese: 野球の試合は次の日曜に延期となった。
english: The baseball game was put off till next Sunday.

japanese: 野球は全然好きじゃないんだ。
english: I don't like baseball at all.

japanese: 野球は好きじゃないの？
english: Don't you like baseball?

japanese: 野球って、やったことある？
english: Have you ever played baseball?

japanese: 野球やるなら、バットとボール、それからグローブが要るよ。
english: You need a bat, a ball and gloves to play baseball.

japanese: 野球はどうかな？
english: How about playing baseball?
